title: bbc press doesnt get tabloids right
story: Theories have ranged from Keeley Hawes’ acting to Richard Madden’s arse, without considering a more obvious possibility.Every other competing drama was either too dull , too grim , or just too rubbish.Which brings me to Press, a series I’d wanted to avoid on the obvious grounds there was never any possibility I was going to like a BBC drama about tabloids.But what the hell. It was a quiet week, so I watched the first four episodes and, to my surprise and delight, I hated Press even more than I expected.The set-up’s the deal-breaker, of course. We’ve got a right-wing red-top called The Post, that’s very obviously meant to be The Sun, and a left-wing broadsheet The Herald, which is equally obviously , house Bible of the BBC.The former is edited by soul-selling clone Duncan Allen, played by the brilliant Ben Chaplin, who does actually resemble a couple of ex-colleagues.By rights then, the female lead should be The Herald’s editor, Amina Chaudury, played by Priyanga Burford.But she can’t act, so the responsibility’s fallen to Charlotte Riley as northern, working-class brick of Deputy News Editor Holly Evans, who fits the social profile of your averagewoman about as comfortably as Roy Chubby Brown fits a mankini.Next weird thing you probably notice about Press is that nearly all the characters are giving speeches, rather than talking normally to each other.Especially the insufferable broadsheet hacks, who never stop reminding each other “we speak the truth to the powerful”, and that “people buy The Herald for the truth”.Why do people buy The Post Sun It’s never really occurred to writer Mike “Doctor Foster” Bartlett, who clearly didn’t read our newspaper before he sat down to type Press, at his desk on the summit of Mount Olympus, and has probably never met a tabloid reader either, without telling them: “Keep the change.”How can I be so sure Because it’s got almost every single professional and technical aspect wrong, from Duncan’s insistence he’s going to do a spread “On page five and six” , to the week one headline The Post produced about the gay, blackmailed footballer who committed suicide: “Parents never knew their son.”Which is the sort of meaningless, esoteric b******s that would get thrown back at a student newspaper sub.That’s another unconvincing thing about Press, incidentally. No one swears. And I wouldn’t mind so muchthere were some decent stories to see us through, but there aren’t.There’s a Katie Hopkins figure floating around, a few cut-and-pasted bits of very old tabloid legendand some deep state conspiracy cobblers, which the BBC’s probably got written into Raa Raa The Noisy Lion these days.Duncan also has the vague hots for Holly, until such time as Ed off the newsdesk tells him she likes having it off in a grey vest.That’s about your lot, though.As always happens when British TV tries to dramatise the Press, the writer’s left-of-centre political agenda and prejudices trump everything .This is why Americans do it so much better, andyou want to see how newspapers really operate you’ll get a much better idea from Billy Wilder’s  film The Front Page than you ever will from Press.I’ll say this for the BBC production team though, they might not have much of an ear for newspaper dialogue, but they’ve got a hell of an eye for interior design and have duplicated one item of our office kitchen crockery perfectly.Mugs.“I don’t bend in the middle any more, to be honest.”Then just slap him around a bit.Improvise, woman.FURTHER proof,it were needed, there’s not a single television format that can’t be improved by the presence of one or two of the Happy Mondays arrived on Friday.A special BBC Music Day edition of Bargain Hunt, featuring Bez and Rowetta versus Pulp’s Jarvis Cocker and Candida Doyle, which will go down in daytime TV folklore.Attempting to keep them in some sort of order, at the Kent showground’s antique fair, was BH regular Charlie Ross, who didn’t get very far with his preliminary question: “How did it all start with the Happy Mondays, Bez ”“You really don’t want to know.”So you really couldn’t blame him for looking a bit nervous when he sent the pair of them away with £ in used notes.Half an hour later, though, Bez and Rowetta were back, with three items, including a biscuit tin and a to-die-for rustic, bygone horse collar mirror that’s yours for just  quid.It made them a respectable £ profit at auction, as well, and flattened Pulp’s efforts in the process.At which point things got a bit dark.Charlie noted “an irregularity”, the Mondays were hauled back on set, like guilty schoolkids, and the host was forced to explain that the winsome and very obliging woman at the back of the auction hall, who kept bidding for his items was in fact: “Bez’s girlfriend.”Not angry, Bez, just disappointed.IF you’ve never seen the brilliant Simpsons episode where Homer gives Pinchy, his pet lobster, a really hot bath, Google it as soon as you can.Then immediately after, watch Channel ’s darkly funny latest episode of Celebrity Island With Bear Grylls, where a pig wandered into camp, on Sunday night.Even more obligingly it then started fattening itself up on the celebs’ leftovers and inviting the obvious by crapping its load everywhere.While some sensed dinner, Towie’s Pete Wicks had a better idea.He named the pig Colin, took it for a walk and then tethered it with a rope to some rocks.Whereupon Colin, with the sort of demonic squeals and grunts you last heard on Deliverance, promptly strangled himself to death.Presented with this tragedy, you or I or Martin Kemp from Spandau Ballet, might’ve drawn the obvious conclusion and, like Homer Simpson, tucked in Not this lot.Instead Colin was buried at sea, with full military honours, to avoid “hurting Pete’s feelings”, floating off into the sunset like a warning to humanity.This MorningSemra Haksever: “I call myself an eclectic witch, so I take dferent little bits of magic from all over the place.So it’s all b******sOur journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: julia hartley brewer safe space ban
story: The party issued the edict yesterday because of complaints that she had violated its safe space at last weeks conference in Liverpool by shouting “boo”.Ms Hartley-Brewer, who hosts the :am-am breakfast who on talkRADIO, recorded a light-hearted video mocking the safe space - which had a sign on its door stating: “This area is for us by anyone,” adding “It is not monitored.”Labour accused her of committing a “hate crime” against disabled people who felt vulnerable.In an email to talkRADIO yesterday Labour said: “We received a number of complaints about her behaviour during conference on our premises which we have looked into.“The Conference Arrangements Committee has decided that Julia Hartley-Brewer’s conduct and the considerable distress she caused to vulnerable groups, coupled with her refusal to apologise despite being given several opportunities, falls below the acceptable standards we uphold.“Therefore, she will not be accredited for Labour Party Conference next year. title: budget must put money in pockets
story: For all the wise words in his conference speech — on the opportunities of new technology, the horric dangers of Corbyn’s socialism and the importance of job-creating businesses — he needs answers to more immediate questions.The signs are ominous. The Chancellor, while admitting “st Century capitalism must deliver” for ordinary people, apparently intends to take MORE of our money for the NHS in his upcoming Budget.Polls apparently show voters are OK with that. But wait till it comes out of wage packets. Skint workers won’t thank the Tories for bailing out the health ­service. They’ll desert them for grabbing yet more of their take-home pay.Mr Hammond’s speech wasn’t all bad. His case against socialism was well put. Likewise his view that no sane party should try to outbid Corbyn’s ruinous spending pledges. We welcome his proposed digital services tax on Google and Facebookit can be made to work. ut Tory fortunes hinge on Brexit — and pay rises easily outstripping inflation.The Budget MUST put more money in pockets . . . not remove it with a tax raid or a suicidal rise in fuel duty.THE EU’s cry-bullies are OUTRAGED that Jeremy Hunt compared their aggression to the old Soviet Union. Well, diddums.He noted, quite reasonably, that Brussels’ forcible attempts to lock Britain in and deter others from leaving was ­reminiscent of the Soviet empire’s treatment of its member states.It is a figure of speech. The Foreign Secretary’s not literally comparing Juncker to Stalin’s regime of mass murder. And the EU has no defence. Which is why its lackeys, such as curtain-haired clown Guy Verhofstadt, instead wilfully misinterpreted him for dramatic effect.One even whined it could “damage relations” with other member states. Are they for real  The French president brands Brexit campaigners “liars” — implying .million Brits are dupes. Donald Tusk humiliates our PM. But WE’RE in danger of souring relations.Give it a rest, EU fools.HOW appalling that the sisters of terror victim cop Keith Palmer have no Legal Aid to pursue the truth at his inquest.Michelle Palmer and Angela Clark want to hire an independent expert to assess whether a permanent armed presence at Parliament’s Carriage Gates entrance might have saved their brother.But the Legal Aid Agency hasn’t processed their application. title: more young people are feeling lonely
story: The Eleanor Rigby of Beatles legend: “All the lonely people, where do they all come from ”An answer emerged this week — and they come from a surprising place.The loneliest people are healthy, thriving young adults, kicking off their career and probably renting a room in a city.According to new university research for the BBC, levels of loneliness are highest among  to -year-olds, with  per cent saying they often, or very often, feel it. In contrast, the over-s are positively chipper: Only  per cent of this group reported feelings of isolation.Now, I’m  and, depressingly, these statistics don’t surprise me.At first glance, it looks like young people have it easy when it comes to making friends.At  or thereabouts, more than  per cent of them will be packed off to university where they’ll move in with a group of like-minded people of the same age and be encouraged to drink and party like there’s no tomorrow.Which, when you’re only required to stumble out of bed for one pm lecture, there essentially isn’t.Rather than relying on friends of tenuous friends for dubious introductions, young people these days can simply download an app and get the details of thousands of eligible strangers delivered straight to their mobile phones.Add into the mix social media ­— which allows its users to connect with everyone they’ve ever met instantaneously at any given moment — and it’s hard to imagine how any young people could possibly be lonely, let alone  per cent.But there are two sides to every coin.University — though a godsend when it comes to meeting new people — can be a problem when it comes to staying in touch with them. Saddled with bottomless debt, young graduates simply don’t have the cash to socialise.When a round for six at a London pub will set you back  quid, is it any wonder that more and more young people are opting to stay at home Dating apps, too, come with their pitfalls. Yes, it’s nice to have a database of singletons in your pocket, but the ubiquity of Tinder and Bumble mean it’s now considered almost socially awkward to speak to someone you fancy in person.A friend of mine, who has absolutely no problem propositioning women on Tinder, hasn’t yet found the courage to ask for his next-door neighbour’s number, four months after she moved in.As for social media, young people like me are increasingly discovering that “staying connected” is a mixed blessing at best. With no excuse to lose touch, my generation holds on to friends we’ve outgrown, leaving us with no time to make new ones. It may sound callous, but there’s an art to shedding friends, and thanks to our social media addiction, we seem to have lost it.What’s more, earnest  to -year-olds seem to be taking to heart the faddish health advice that adults have been merrily ignoring for years, making it even harder for them to socialise because they fear alcohol, and even food.At the end of a recent party I got chatting to a fun young woman, so I suggested some pub grub at a boozer to round off the evening. How wrong I was.She explained in detail she was vegan and on a gluten-free diet , so the pub menu would not cater for her needs.I decided not to pursue it.So I say it’s time snowflake millennials took a bit of responsibility for their own feelings of isolation.Last month commentators wagged their fingers at the big tech companies after a survey by charity YoungMinds revealed a greater number of young people view social media as having a negative impact on the way they feel about themselves than those who report a positive impact.But it was never suggested depressed young people should simply put away their phones and do something .Mollycoddled millennials believe having a thriving social circle is a human right, rather than an ongoing project.Instead of popping to the pub for a pick-me-up with whoever happens to be around, a lonely young person will all too often turn to the internet for a spot of indulgent self-reflection, or to the gym for Insta-friendly self-improvement.As a result, pubs are closing at a rate of  a day, and sites such as Tumblr are overflowing with posters instructing users to “forget the haters” and “shine like the star that you are”.Of course, social media is made to be addictive. But surely putting down a phone can’t be an insurmountable challenge for an educated generation of young people  Dwelling on yourself is the surest route to a lonely lestyle, so instead of posting doleful, introspective memes on social media or clinging to tired old friendships, lonely young people should find the guts to get outside and look outwards.Making and keeping real friends takes work, and it’s time young people started putting the hours in.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: theresa may brexit second referendum
story: The PM ruled out holding a new vote on the EU or a General Election as she vowed to “deliver on Brexit”.She told BBC Breakfast: “People have had a vote, we voted in . The British people voted to leave the EU.I think its important for trust in politics and politicians that people can now feel that we as a Government are delivering on that vote.We gave people a choice, they chose. We should be delivering on that choice.Speaking at the Tory conference in Birmingham, Mrs May also insisted she won’t give in to Labour demands that she calls a General Election which could see her thrown out of power.The PM said: “We’re acting in the national interest - it is not in the national interest to have a General Election.”Asked how long she will last at No , Mrs May told the BBCs Today programme: I am in this for the long term - not just for the Brexit deal but also for the domestic agenda that we’re setting out at this conference.Mrs May admitted she was bruised by her clash with EU leaders at Salzburg last month - saying she needed a stf drink when she got home to husband Philip.She told LBC: I don’t remember what Philip said about it - I think when I got home he probably poured me a stf drink.Hitting out at bullying Eurocrats who wont be straight with the UK, the PM added: I’ve shown nothing but respect to the European Union and the UK deserves the same.But she also slapped down Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt for comparing Brussels bosses to the Soviet Union.The Prime Minister said: “As I sit around that table in the European Union, there are countries there who used to be part of the Soviet Union. They are now democratic countries.“I can tell you that the two organisations are not the same.”Mrs May will make her big conference speech tomorrow - although first she must see off a challenge from Boris Johnson who will address activists at a fringe event this afternoon.She insisted there wont be a repeat of last years meltdown where a bad cough meant she could barely finish her speech - telling LBC: I assume youve been able to hear everything Ive been saying.I will be ensuring that I will be standing up there and speaking strongly, and speaking strongly not just about getting the best Brexit deal for the UK but about the real opportunities there are for people here in the UK for the future.

title: passenger removed southwest airlines flight attendant n word
story: Witnesses said the vile passenger became infuriated after the flight attendant told her to put her table away for take-off on the flight from Chicago to Houston.Appalling footage shot on Sunday morning by another traveller showed the woman unleashing a tirade of abuse at staff.As she is being led off the plane she can be seen using the racial slur, labelling a member of staff a “stupid n*****” as she walks down the aisle.Her vile behaviour delayed the plane leaving by an hour but fellow passengers cheered as she was forced to deplane.She was met by local cops when she left the aircraft with the footage later being shared on social media.In other footage she was shown repeating the racial slur as she was removed from the aircraft.The passenger is as yet to be identied and has so far not been formally charged by police.Southwest Airlines told Fox News in a statement: “On Flight # with scheduled service from Chicago Midway to Houston Hobby on Saturday morning, our reports indicate that a Customer refused to comply with our Flight Crews instructions after boarding and before the flight departed Chicago.“The customer became unruly and verbally abusive toward our flight attendants, and the decision was made toto the gate to deplane the Customer, where she was met by local law enforcement officers.“Our employees handled the situation professionally with grace and class, and we do not condone or tolerate such profane and unruly behaviour on board our aircraft.“Once the customer deplaned the aircraft, the flight resumed to Houston Hobby, arriving about an hour later than originally scheduled.”Southwest Airlines made international headlines in April this year when a passenger was killed after being sucked out of a plane when shrapnel smashed through a window.Albuquerque banker and mother of two Jenner Riordan died after being partially sucked out of a Southwest plane window on April , .

title: mystery ancient rock carvings indian hunter gatherer civilisation ancient
story: The incredible images were found hidden beneath the soil atop hillocks in the Konkan region of Maharashtra.Experts believe the carvings, known as petroglyohs, were created by a hunter-gatherer community - because many of the images are drawings of animals, reports the BBC.The discovery suggests the civilisation could have migrated to India from Africa, where many of the animals depicted are found.And the archaeologists believe the drawings may be the oldest petroglyphs ever found, possibly dating back to the year , BC.The etchings were found by a group of explorers led by Sudhir Risbood and Manoj Marathe, who began searching for the images in earnest after observing a few in the area. Many were found in village temples and played a part in local folklore.Mr Risbood told the BBC: We walked thousands of kilometres. People started sending photographs to us and we even enlisted schools in our efforts to find them. We made students ask their grandparents and other village eldersthey knew about any other engravings. This provided us with a lot of valuable information.The pair found petroglphs in and around  villages, but only about five of the communities were aware that the images existed.Tejas Garge, director of the Maharashtra state archaeology department, also told the BBC: We have not found any pictures of farming activities. But the images depict hunted animals and theres detailing of animal forms. So this man knew about animals and sea creatures. That indicates he was dependent on hunting for food.All kinds of animals, including sharks, whales and turtles feature in the carvings, while human figures and geometrical designs also appear.Since the remarkable discovery, the researchers have been working to document the thousands of ancient carvings and spur efforts to preserve them.The state government has designated  million rupees to study  of the petroglyphs in greater detail, according to the BBC.

title: voodoo dolls russian city krasnodar mystery
story: Pensioners complained of blood pressure problems after seeing the spooky mannequins nailed to fences or propped up at bus stops.Residents called for an explanation of the dozens of weird dolls which reportedly appeared overnight in Zavetny in the Krasnodar region.There were also complaints to police.One resident told local media: “Creepy dolls are nailed to the pillars, fences and bus stops.“The little girl mannequins are pierced with needles and tied with black threads.”Another householder said: “Two were sitting at a bus stop.“A doll in a in a pink ball gown was found in the park.”A local warned: “A curse has been put on our village.”Several were eyeless or one-armed and were all dressed in girls clothes or school unorms.Head of the local council Dmitry Barkov said: “We have urgently brought together police officers to instruct them to calm people.”Police are studying CCTV cameras to identy those who distributed the dolls around the area even though planting voodoo dolls is not a crime, say reports.Meanwhile a local security officer has admitted dumping the mannequins - “the same size as a child” - at a local tip.Tatiana Kokoreva claimed they belonged to a local culture museum and were previously used in a puppet theatre which closed long ago.They were no longer needed and the security officer thought her daughter, a teacher, could use them.But the school rejected them as unsafe and too scary, so she dumped them.She insisted she was not responsible for dressing them up as voodoo dolls.

title: girl found walking streets pyjamas woodley berkshire
story: Thames Valley Police searched for the unattended girl, spotted wearing pink pyjamas, in two separate incidents in Woodley, Berkshire.She was first sighted at am on Saturday morning by a worried woman who called the police, triggering a frantic -hour manhunt.But the search was eventually called off because no one matching the little girls description was reported missing.Then cops got another call late on Monday night saying that a child in her pyjamas was completely alone near a parade of shops.Officers scrambled to a local Lidl where they found the seven-year-old by herself.They quickly established that it was the same girl who was spotted early on Saturday morning.After finding her, police reported the incidents to Social Services.It is understood that cops have interviewed her family.The girl, who has not been named, is believed to have let herself out of her home in darkness and then later ed home to her house in Woodley.Police said that as a result of both incidents, safeguarding measures were being enacted to protect the child.A spokesman for Thames Valley Police said: Officers attended the Lidl store in Headley Road, Woodley, at around pm following reports of a young girl walking alone in the precinct.On arrival, officers located a seven-year-old girl. The girl was ed home to her parents and is safe and well.From conversations with the girl, it is now known this girl is the same person that was reported being alone in the Woodley area on Saturday morning, and she is from the local area.We received reports that a young girl had been seen alone in Woodlands Avenue at around am on Saturday.Officers carried out signicant search activity in the area and spoke to members of the community, including local children and their families, however no children with welfare concerns were identied.

title: kate middleton materinity leave visit forest school paddington rec
story: But the Duchess of Cambridge clearly had her own children on her mind as she greeted students at the forest school in Paddington, cooing over a seven-month-old almost the same age as my little boy.The mother has been on maternity leave for five months, with her visit to Paddington Recreation Ground her first official solo event since giving birth to Prince Louis in April.And today the -year-old was inundated with young fans, left beaming as a little girl rushed forward to hug her around her waist.Kate, clearly surprised, laughed as the girl gripped her arms around her waist, and a second rushed in to make it a royal group hug.The duchess, wearing a khaki green Fjällräven jacket, a silk Joseph and Penelope Chilvers shirt, and riding boots, is today visiting Sayers Croft Forest School and Wildle Garden to see how it is helping childrens emotional and physical well-being.It was a charming start to Kates first official solo event since welcoming third child Louis into the world.The duchess made sure to speak to as many students and families as possible as she was taken around the facility - drawn in by some of the younger kids at her welcome.Meeting a seven-month-old boy called Romi at the Paddington Recreation Ground, Kate gushed: He’s very chatty, he’s almost the same age as my little boy.Prince Williams we seemed happy to spend time with the young St Stephens school students, listening to story time with Monkey Queen, read to them by Sayers Croft forest school leader Jennie Miles.The royal, who was gted posies by four-year-old Janine, also helped to hand out cups of juice and papers to make crowns.And she was left in stitches as one student promised there would be no boring bits on the tour.The duchess replied: This is so cool, I cant wait to see it.The seasoned royals visit even closed her car door herself - with a little help - after fans went crazy that her sister-in-law Meghan Markle was last week seen doing the same.The forest school, which had more than , visits by schoolchildren from across Westminster and neighbouring boroughs last year, gives inner city children the chance to engage with the natural world.Although the duchess has appeared at events such as the RAF centenary, Trooping the Colour and Wimbledon, and celebrated the Duke and Duchess of Sussexs wedding, this is her first official solo engagement since Louis arrival.The mum has previously spoken about her love for the outdoors, making todays visit the perfect fit for her .Visiting a primary school in South West London last November to see its gardening projects, she told pupils she had fond memories of being outdoors as a child.She also said she was passing that passion on to her own children.The duchess, who supports a number of mental health charities and initiatives, is passionate about offering children early social and emotional support.Its been a big year for Kate Middleton and the royal family, having welcomed several new members into the Firm this year.Meghan Markle married Prince Harry in a lavish ceremony in Windsor in May.Kate will also become an aunt when her sister Pippa Middleton gives birth to her first child.Pippa, who married financier James Matthews, , is expected to welcome a child this month.Kate was the first person after Pippa’s husband, James Matthews, to hear the good news.

title: car driving full tree branches stockport
story: His windscreen was obstructed and he couldnt reach the gear stick as he drove down Heaton Moor Road, Stockport.Police called the move absolute madness.PC Andy Monaghan said hed never seen anything like it and he had risked seriously injuring someone.The man in his s, who has not been named, had been doing gardening work for an elderly couple on September  and was taking the leafy branches to the tip when he was stopped by police.He decided to fill the blue Toyota Corolla to the brim with branches so he would only have to make one trip.But he was asked to empty his car in order to drive safely and then had to make multiple journeys to the tip to throw the branches away.He must now attend court accused of driving offences.PC Monaghan said: He thought hed be fine, but the weather was heavy and he had limited control.I wasnt shocked because Ive previously worked in traffic [but] it was absolute madness.

title: hounsdown school hampshire girls skirts distracting curvy figures
story: Ellie Porter and Jasmin Stacey, both , claim they were threatened with detention at Hounsdown School in Totton, Hampshire and told their MS skirts should be shin .Ellie Porter-Smith and her friend Jasmin Stacey, from Hampshire, were reportedly told their skirts were inappropriate and distractingEllies mum Gemma Porter claims one staff member suggested the skirts were inappropriate for curvy girls.She said she was horried the girls were being punished for their body shape because its out of their control.She said: [They] said our girls cant wear the skirts as theyre too close-fitting on them.[They] said its okay for girls with slender figures to wear the standard school skirt but its NOT okay for girls with curvy figures to wear it.Ms Porter claims the unorm issue came to light last month when Ellie ed to school after the summer break.She said she phoned the school to ask why the the skirt was deemed inappropriate - but claims she wasnt given a proper answer.She said: I asked who the skirt was distracting exactly, but the teacher wouldn’t say.I was just told that I had to get a new skirt by the morning or Ellie would be held in internal exclusion .Ms Porter said she decided to keep Ellie home the next day because she couldnt buy a skirt that evening. Jasmins mum, Emma, did the same.The two mums then agreed to take the girls shopping the next day at school outfitters School Kit, to ensure the right skirts were bought.Ms Porter said: It was really embarrassing for the girls. Standing there in the changing rooms in their pants, trying on skirts.They felt totally humiliated.”Ellie’s aunt Carly Hughes, from Gosport, took to Facebook to slam the school over the unorm row.She said her niece was “being punished for something out of her control, basically for being curvy and for skirts not fitting her body shape.The post - which has been shared more than , times - provoked fury among other parents, with several mums branding the school unreasonable. A Hounsdown School spokesman said: The school is unable to refer to or comment specically about an inidual student or complaint.However, in the event that a student comes to school in unorm that does not meet the school’s unorm policy, as set and agreed by the governing body, then in the first instance the school will contact the family to request alternative unorm.We have, where needed, supported students and families to source appropriate unorm items for students even going to shops to get unorm to assist parents and students in meeting the school’s unorm policy.Sun Online has approached Hounsdown School for further comment.

title: mark bristow randgold hunting elephant leopard south africa
story: Mark Bristow was photographed with several trophy kills including elephants, antelope, gazelle, a hippo, buffalo and a zebra taken in Africa.In promotional material dating from  to  he posed with a dead lion and leopard even though since  he has served on the conservation council of Panthera.The council  - dedicated to the welfare of wild cats - also includes actress Glenn Close as co-chairman, and actor Jeremy Irons.Bristow appears in promotional images on the website of Hunters  Guides Africa, a South Africa-based professional hunting tour operator.Mr Bristow, , who was born in South Africa but now lives in London, has been the CEO of mining giant Randgold since .The £bn company has a partnership with the Mali Elephant Project, which works to protect the worlds last remaining desert elephant herds.It is currently in the process of being bought by Canada’s Barrick  which will make it the world’s largest gold miner.Randgold told the : Legal, well-regulated hunting can and does deliver benefits for both wildle conservation and the livelihoods of indigenous communities living with wildle.Led by Mark Bristow, Randgold Resources has invested in a wide range of bioersity programmes in its host countries ... and is bringing together conservation professionals and scientists to develop a tailored method for the mining industry in Africa to restore the continent’s bioersity.However, the international wildle charity Born Free was far from impressed with the actions of Bristow - reported to be the longest serving FTSE  boss.Its president Will Travers said: “Mark Bristow is obviously fond of big numbers. His company, Randgold, just bought by Canada’s Barrick Gold, is worth at least £bn.But there are other numbers he may be less willing to discuss. Mr Bristow shoots African elephants – there are about , left.Mr Bristow shoots African hippo – there are about , left. He also shoots zebra, antelope, gazelle and leopard.He will claim that it supports conservation and development but evidence suggests that only around three per cent of what people like Mr Bristow spend on their deadly predilection ends up in ­local communities.“Trophy hunting is not illegal. It is, however, deeply controversial. Large donations to conservation organisationsdo nothing to mitigate the horror that will surely be felt by many investors, shareholders and the general public, who will share my sense of disgust and abhorrence at people of wealth and privilege who kill natural treasures of the world - for fun.”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: theres something wrong with this penguin enclosure can you see what it is
story: The new attraction at Exotic Zoo in Telford, Shrops., cost tens of thousands of pounds to build and had been hotly anticipated - but can you see what was wrong with it The enclosure is filled exclusively with model penguins because zoo owners couldnt get the real thing.A delivery of six Humboldt penguins was expected this July but the zoo was unable to get any due to an outbreak of avian malaria.So instead they put plastic figurines in as the enclosure is too specialist to house any other animals.Zoo director Scott Adams took the decision to use the models until they can get actual penguins. Scott said: Weve just timed it really badly.The enclosure is the zoos most expensive to date and we had hoped to have it open for the start of the summer holidays. But then disaster struck.Because of the outbreak of penguin malaria we were unable to get hold of three pairs we had been planning to get in for visitors to enjoy.Instead weve had to use le-size models of ious dferent species of penguins so we can at least educate visitors to an extent.Scott said that avain malaria had been catastrophic for penguins in the UK.He said: Lots of zoos,not most zoos, have lost a lot of penguins and in some case most of their stock.The zoos even planning to dress a member of his staff in a penguin costume over the Christmas period as he doesnt believe the problem will be rectied until the new year.But theres no prospect of any real penguins arriving at Exotic Zoo until next year.People visiting the zoo huddled together in their disappointment.Julie Fearn, , of Shrewsbury, said: It does look a bit weird and its a little bit disappointing because it would be lovely to see the penguins.Dad-of-one Paul Lawley of Telford, added: Its a shame theyve spent all this money and got nothing to show for it. Its really sad news about the penguins dying too.But I would have just left it emptyI was them. It looks like the Madame Tussauds version of a zoo.

title: theresa may dup arlene foster northern ireland border vote brexit
story: DUP boss Arlene Foster said she would never accept a Brexit deal that brought in any new dferences in trade rules between Northern Ireland and the rest of the UK.She laid down the gauntlet barely  hours after it emerged the PM is plotting to offer the EU dferent regulatory rules for Northern Ireland as a Brexit insurance backstop.Ms Foster told The Sun: “No, no, no. No additional regulations – because that would make us dferent from the rest of the UK.”Downing Street was hoping they could convince the DUP to back the plan as it would not mean Northern Ireland operating under separate customs rules.But arriving at Tory conference in Birmingham today, Ms Foster said it was their “red line” that we “cannot have either a customs border down the Irish sea or a regulatory border because that would make us separate from the rest of the UK.”She also turned her guns on the EU - blasting: We are not going to allow the United Kingdom to be broken up by Brussels or by anybody .“Barnier cannot annexe off part of the United Kingdom so he can say that that’s the way forward.And in a stern warning Ms Foster added: We are not bluffing on this issue.Her DUP Westminster boss Nigel Dodds said it was ludicrous that Mrs May had left it to the last minute to decide on a backstop plan for the Northern Irish border.He said he found it slightly odd that the government had yet to show the DUP a draft plan with just a fortnight before the crucial EU summit.And he warned her that he would march his  DUP MPs through the voting lobbies alongside Jeremy Corbyn to vote down any Brexit deal that compromised on their red lines.Mr Dodds said the DUP would make a decision on the PMs final Brexit deal based on whether it meets our red line, adding: If others join with us on that, great.”In an extraordinary blast at the PM, he said: “There’s only a fortnight left now until October’s council meeting.It seems a bit ludicrous to us that the British government are still not in a position to put forward proposals to show anybody.Instead some people are running around briefing people behind the scenes - it all seems slightly odd to us.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: snake found inside oven by oap cooking chips
story: The African brown house snake had slithered into the elderly couple’s home on Macclesfield Road in Hazel Grove, Stockport.They called the RSPCA and an inspector was sent to their home. Initially he couldn’t find the runaway reptile, but it eventually turned up again two days later on Friday, September .Fortunately, the couple were animal lovers and were concerned for the welfare of the non-venomous snake, although they admitted the bizarre discovery put them off their chippy tea.The woman, who did not want to be named, said: “When I opened the oven door and saw it for the first time I got the shock of my le.“I have recently had a cataract operation and was wonderingmy eyes were deceiving me - but my husband saw it too.“We are big animal lovers and just wanted to make sure the snake was safe so we were pleased that he was rescued by the RSPCA.“I gave the inspector a big hug and a cup of tea afterwards but I went off the idea of oven chips so sent my husband to the fish and chip shop instead!”It is not knownthe snake is male or female at this stage so it has been given the unisex name Sammy by a reptile keeper who will now care for it.Inspector Andy Harris was called to the scene and was surprised to see the size of the snake.He said: “When I arrived I expected to find a small snake but this one was quite long - at least three foot.“I managed to coax the snake from the oven and was able to safely get hold of it with specialist equipment and then contain it securely.“The snake is an African brown house snake, which is a non-venomous species, so I suspect that he is a pet that has escaped or been abandoned.“It must have squeezed through a wall cavity of this couple’s home and there is a hole at the back of the oven where the gas jets come up so was probably attracted by the warmth.“It was lucky the couple didn’t pre-heat the oven first.”This species of snake is often very nervous, but is not prone to biting.They are frequently found in and around human dwellings in Africa, where they consume rodents, small lizards, and even birds.Many of the snakes that the RSPCA’s officers are called to collect are thought to be escaped pets.The RSPCA recommends owners invest in an enclosure suitable for the particular species and that it is kept securewhen unattended to prevent accidental escape.The RSPCA advises anyone who sees a stray exotic snake to keep a safe distance, call the helpline on    and monitor the animal until inspectors arrive.

title: boy taser in college

It was shocking to see.”Cleveland Police said he posed a threat to staff and pupils, adding: “He did not suffer any adverse effects.”He was arrested on suspicion of criminal damage, public order offences and assaulting an officer.A college spokesman said: “Staff called the police, who dealt with the incident swtly and as they felt appropriate.”GOT a news story  RING us on    or WHATSAPP on  or EMAIL exclusive@the-sunOur journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: manchester university student union bans clapping jazz hands
story: The University of Manchester Students Union passed the resolution to ban clapping at their events at a meeting on September , according to student newspaper the Mancunion.The students will now use the British Sign Language clapping - or jazz hands - instead of traditional clapping, whooping, and cheering so that clapping can be more inclusive, according to the paper.It was argued that the loud noise of traditional clapping and whooping pose an issue to students with anxiety or sensory issues.BSL clapping – or, jazz hands – would be a more inclusive form of expression, the paper said.Sara Khan, the Liberation and Access Officer, authored the motion to encourage student groups and societies to do the same, and to include BSL clapping as a part of inclusion training.Each motion needs a  per cent majority to be passed and, according to the paper, Ms Khans motion faced little opposition.The Mancunion noted the National Union of Students has been using BSL clapping since .In April , delegates from the University of Durham proposed a motion which said that all clapping and whooping must be banned from future NUS events.The access needs of disabled students are disregarded overlooked in terms of conference member behaviour and NUS structures, it said, and called for “reduced cheering or unnecessary loud noises on conference floor, including whooping and clapping.In a statement to the , a spokesman for the NUS said they dont actively stop our members from clapping, they choose to be respectful.”

story: What is most breathtaking about this years IPOs in the US is the proportion of companies coming to market that have been loss-making.According to data compiled by Jay Ritter, professor of finance at the University of Floridas Warrington College of Business and one of the worlds foremost experts on IPOs, some % of companies to have floated in the US this year do not make a profit.His findings, first reported in the Wall Street Journal, cover the period since .Recent examples highlighted by the Journal include SVMK, the owner of online survey provider SurveyMonkey, whose shares jumped by % on its stock market debut last week despite it never having made a profit.Tech stocks have been at the forefront of this, including the cloud company Dropbox, whose prospectus even warned that it may never become profitable.Other well-known, but as yet unprofitable, tech companies to have floated this year include DocuSign, the electronic signature technology company, whose shares floated at  each in April but which closed on Monday evening at ..Carbon Black, a cyber security firm yet to make a profit, saw its shares float at  in May and then rise to  before falling back. Music streaming service Spoty is probably the most high-profile tech company to have floated this year without ever having made a profit.But this phenomenon of flotations involving non-profitable companies does not only reflect the ongoing popularity of tech stocks.It also reflects surging interest in biotech stocks and also the boom in cannabis-related companies.

title: what tory brexit going look
story: NewsopinionThis is what the Tory Brexit is going to look likeTheres bad news for borders, badgers and BorisShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsopinion"Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThere are  days until Brexit, theyve got a full tank of prats, half a pack of loons, theyre doomed and theyre wearing blue rosettes. Welcome to the Conservative Party conference of , where the Tories are trying to pretend they can organise a knees-up that doesnt somehow end in whacking themselves in the testicles.Its day one, and theyve already failed. Their Great Blond Hope has not only been victim of a Big Daddy splash by Lord Digby Jones, hes been impersonated by Phil Voldemort Hammond and had his ideas characterised as not much good by David Mine Are No Better Davis.We are now uncomfortably close to the arbitrary date for leaving the European Union, chosen by a Prime Minister who herself was chosen because she wasnt someone , and as is the way with things on horizons it looks worryingly like an out-of-control hydrogen explosion.We all know whats happened - the referendum supposed to uny the Tories has caused them to turn on each other like cannibals who gave up chlorinated chicken for Lent, the question supposed to be settled for a generation remains unanswered, and Theresa May is still PM primarily because she isnt someone .So what is Brexit going to look like, under the Tories  . Project Oh Dear Jeremy Hunt is a man who has more in common with an Anglepoise lamp than the rest of the human race. He can be pointed, turned on, and turned off again, but usually fails to illuminate anyone. He is now second-favourite to be Prime Minister next year, which should be adequate proof of just how boked the Tories are.Boris is trolling, Sajid and Gavin are manoeuvring, Chris Grayling is in a siding outside Melton Mowbray and Hunt - a man who, the Leveson Inquiry heard, tried to hide behind trees to avoid journalists while still being visible to them - is now, let me say it again, one of the favourites. Its a bit like saying the green Opal Fruit is your favourite. Or that the USSR, which invaded countries that tried to leave it and killed millions, is just like the EU, which negotiates, even with people who dont know what theyre doing. . Project You Cant Be Serious  Having toured the country in a bus promising to give our EU subscription to the NHS, the Tories have since said: a well still have to pay a subscription b it will be higher, without a rebatec by the way, well be cutting pound.bn off the NHSToday the spiritual leader of the Brextremists has suggested we spend our foreign aid budget on saving elephants, because they remind him of Beethovens Fth Symphony. Hang the education projects, stuff the small-scale charities who exist entirely because of foreign aid, and lets get all worked up about the  pence in every pound national profit that we spend on foreigners. Boo hiss to foreigners! Elephants are British! Wait, what  . Project Is This Really The Best You Could Do  Brexit, the Tories are assuring us and their donors, will mean a bonfire of unnecessary rules and regulations about meaningless, bureaucratic tripe like child car seats, not getting killed at work and hiding your money from the taxman.It gives us a chance to set our own rules such as only banning dangerous cladding  months after it burned  people alive, and onlyits on new buildings, which means all the people living in older properties can go sizzle.It also wont matteryou sleep surrounded by highly-flammable material on the sixth floor, oryou dont have a sprinkler system, or the fire exits are blocked or non-existent. After Brexit, you wont want to live anyway. . Project Genuine Fear  The government of the UK is trying to exit a union it doesnt want while protecting one that it does. To do so they are relying on a referendum they say must be respected, while ignoring a referendum they say must be over-ridden.All the people concerned were told beforehand that Brexit would spell the end of the Good Friday Agreement, a hard-won peace in Northern Ireland, and possibly the end of the Union altogether. That they have now,  months from doom, had this explained to them again by a comedian shows just what a bad joke the Tories are.Patrick Kieltys dad was murdered by the Ulster Freedom Fighters for exposing their organised crime. The Tories border solution involves asking those self-same people to pretend theres a border where there isnt one, and file paperwork well in advance before smuggling guns, drugs and people across  miles of hedge that we cant police. Laugh  Youll die. . Project It All Onto Someone Else Presiding over economic chaos  Watching John Lewis go down the pan, the world turn against you, and Jacob Rees-Mogg destroying all his own suggestions by moving his investment funds to the EU and trying to get a trade deal with the Peoples Republic of Jam Jar Or Something Like That  Well, why not shoot some more badgers. Not in the head, thats too quick. Kneecap them and watch them suffer. Burn some cattle, bankrupt some farmers, blame it all on the EUs crazy rules about bovine TB which isnt harmless so long as you pasteurise your milk, mostly doesnt kill cows and could easily be stopped with a vaccineonly we could be bothered.When someone says but Brexit means we can abandon these rules! Save the badgers! point out we still have to abide by EU ruleswe want to sell beef, milk or cheese to the EU. And dont, for heavens sake, let anyone say that the only way to change those rules is to, er, remain in the EU.With a Tory Brexit, hard or soft, youre looking at Jeremy Hunt being in charge while making swingeing NHS cuts, making it quite the worst reboot of a franchise since Indiana Jones And The Hospital Of Doom.Youll see people burning in another tower block before long, a fresh wave of terrorism when we havent dealt with the current one, and Tories blaming badgers, migrants, and anything  that moved because, after Brexit, theyll no longer be able to blame the EU. The Tories have spent the past  years blaming Europe for all the things they cocked up themselves. Without the EU, people are going to blame the Tories. Which is why their days are numbered.

title: brand beckhams more crass class
story: NewsopinionBrand Beckhams more crass than class after swerving speeding fine and celebrating with £, wineWith his speeding and brash lestyle, David Beckham is trashing his own imageShareCommentsByAlison PhillipsColumnist:,  OCT NewsopinionDavid Beckham dodged a speeding conviction on a technicality "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Oh David … where did it all go wrong When did you disappear so far up your own exhaust pipe that you thought launching a top of the range luxury car days after wheedling your way out of a speeding charge was decent behaviour  When did you begin believing your superiority meant you could post a sickeningly smug selfie grumbling about London traffic on the day your case appeared before court  And when did you start thinking your  million followers on Instagram would be entertained that very evening by snaps of you celebrating pulling a fast one on British justice with a pound, bottle of wine  Because whenever it was – the time has certainly arrived when the British public are sick, sore and sorry of you and your publicity junkie family. Some say the rot set into David’s ego the moment he posed in those ludicrous thrones at his OK! themed wedding to Victoria .Perhaps it even pre-dates that, to the dreadful matching leathers look. Only a monstrous ego would enable anyone to leave the house looking like that. Let alone let their partner leave the house in the same outfit.  More recently there has been David’s penchant for spending his leisure time huntin’ and fishin’ dressed up like the Lord of the Manor in pound welliesJust who does this boy from Leytonstone in East London think he is  And I don’t say that because there’s anything wrong with coming from Leytonstone. There’s everything right with coming from Leytonstone. But everything wrong with pretending that you don’t. And by hiding the reality of your le under layers of flash clothes and flashier mates you become the kind of person we Brits instinctively distrust. Some say the warning bells were there in David’s behaviour as far back as that petulant World Cup kick two decades ago.  Certainly by last year the warning bells had become klaxons when emails between him and a publicist were leaked in which he raged about deserving a knighthood from the Queen’s honours committee. ‘Unless it’s a knighthood, f*** off,’ he wrote.Even Beckham’s speeding lawyer Nick ‘Mr Loophole’ Freeman admits ‘from a moral standpoint’ Beckham was in the wrong and only escaped on a technicality when he’d been doing mph in a mph zone.

story: NewsKate Middleton goes back to work five months after giving birth to LouisThe Duchess of Cambridge went casual in jeans and was all smiles as she went mini beast hunting and planted seeds before strolling the wildle garden in Paddington, west LondonShareCommentsByAmber Hicks:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video dont-go-girls-cling-kate-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:,],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailKate Middleton marked the end of her maternity leave and ed to work today as she visited a wildle garden in London. story: News"Amazon is killing every single business worldwide": Lord Alan Sugar says an online tax is needed to save the high streetThe Apprentice star and self-made millionaire knows that saving the high street will be a "dficult task"ShareCommentsByJason BeattieHead of politics:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsLord Sugar has said the struggle to turn around the high street is dficult in the face of surging online shopping "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email As a self-made multi-millionaire and, for the past  years, the star of The Apprentice, Lord Sugar has come to epitomise business wisdom and know-how.Yet when asked for insight into how to turn around the fortunes of our struggling town centres, even he might have to tell himself: “You’re fired!” But he does know where to point the finger at those responsible. “I don’t think there is a way we can revitalise the high street,” he says, grimly.“It’s a dficult task. The companies that are getting bigger and bigger like Amazon are online . “One of things I would like to do is invoke, and I don’t know how you would go about doing this, a tax on online purchases on top of VAT and things like that. But then again, you are going to affect the small-time trader like us. “Amazon, for example, worldwide is killing every single business. Every single business. “You want to buy a camera, you go into Curry’s PC World, you have a look, a nice chap talks to you about the camera and then you say, ‘Yes, you’ll think about it’, then you go home, search the internet and get it online – and it’s delivered the next day. Andyou don’t like it, you can send it back.”  It seems only fair to askLord Sugar shops online. “My we buys stuff online, I don’t buy online,” he says. “For example, hard products like cameras and all that I go to a friend of mine who has a camera shop. “Watches, I go to a friend of mine who sells me watches. I would never buy a watch online,” the -year-old mogul says, flashing a Rolex on his wrist. “I can’t remember the last thing I bought online,” adds the billionaire, who started selling goods out of a van. Lord Sugar, who trades on his no-nonsense image, suggests some high street shops would be okay. “Touchy-feely stuff, where you need to actually go and touch and feel or eat it, I suppose has still got a le,” he says. “But our high street is made up now of coffee shops, delis and little cafes and nail bars, and all that type of stuff.”  Is he not worried our communities could become derelict unless we turn high streets around  “It’s worrying but I don’t know what the solution is,” he says. “Unless it’s some niche market like clothing or dresses or menswear or whatever that’s specialised.” Lord Sugar appears resigned to shypeople now shopping online, saying: “I mean, most people now, young ladies in particular, buy a load of their clothes online. “You have the opportunity of buying five dresses at once and sending four back just to see which one suits you more. “You’ve even got the situation where a nasty person will buy a dress online wear it to a party and send it back anyway.” Lord Sugar, whose dad started in the rag trade, warms to his theme: “On top of that you have giants like Primark and Matalan that now have not the traditional season you used to have in fashion – autumn, winter and summer – but  seasons, every week they are replenishing the store with new range. “And the cost of the merchandise is such it’s disposable. Many years ago, a young lady would buy herself a rather expensive dress in relation to her salary.  “Now she can go and buy a dress for the same price as a gin and tonic and throw it away.” This is not, it should be said, entirely on message with the Mirror’s High Street fightback campaign, which is promoting positive ways of reviving our towns and cities. Today, though, our most famous shybusinessman wants to mainly talk about cakes. In particular, he wants to chat about the Ridiculously Rich cake brand created by Apprentice winner Alana Spencer, which may or may not have been named in honour of the man who hired her. Tonight, the th series of The Apprentice starts on BBC andthe super-keen, super-confident whizzkids class of  want to know what awaits, they should probably have a chat with Alana.  At least that way, the  champion of the hit BBC reality show would get a word in the conversation. Alana wants to tell the Mirror about her new Grab ‘n’ Go range – which includes, appropriately enough, Millionaire’s Shortbread, and she plans to sell through “cakepreneurs”. But this is proving something of a challenge, as every time she starts to speak Lord Sugar interrupts her. These cakepreneurs, explains Alana, sell her products at food festivals, country shows and markets. “Let me try and explain it,” says Lord Sugar. “You have got the ambassadors who have exclusivity for a certain area where they can sell at fairs and places like that.

title: man 23 becomes youngest adult
story: NewsMan, , is youngest in UK to be diagnosed with dementia - after watching it destroy his mumWhile the young man has no signs of the illness now, doctors have told him he could lose the ability to walk, talk and eat for himself at any timeShareCommentsByJames Somper:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video -year-old-man-becomes-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA -year-old man is believed to be the youngest adult in the UK ever diagnosed with dementia after inheriting the disease that killed his mother. Jordan Adams from Redditch, Worcestershire, has been told the chances of getting his condition are less than winning the EuroMillions and says he has been incredibly unlucky. Although he has no signs of the illness now, doctors have said he could lose the ability to walk, talk and eat for himself at any time. He has also been told his le could end in his fties, like his mum Geri, who died at the age of .  Jordan was told he would develop early onset frontotemporal dementia and Parkinson’s Disease after inheriting a gene - which caused the degenerative conditions - from his mum. Last month, doctors gave the entrepreneur the crushing news he had a rare mutation of the MAPT gene, which causes the condition. And he has been warned his health will deteriorate as he gets older. He now plans to have his sperm screened for the gene so he and girlfriend Lucy Thomas, , can start a family before his symptoms develop.  Jordan also plans to tick travelling to Hawai, buying a house, and doing a skye off a bucket list. He said: “When I was told the diagnosis I was devastated. “We had been in the waiting area for what seemed like hours – it was only  minutes but it felt like an eternity. “As soon as I walked into the room I knew it wasn’t a positive result. “Nobody can prepare you for that. “If there are no advancements then I’ll have a shorter le than most. It’s like a death sentence. “Its very hard to explain. Were all dealt cards in le and I was just incredibly unlucky.  Jordan was given the news he had tested positive for the gene when he and sister Kennedy,  decided to get themselves checked after watching mum Geri deteriorate over a period of six years. He was finally given the results on September  after three gruelling months of consultations and blood tests. Jordan said he saw the full impact of the disease while caring for Geri, as he watched her lose the ability to talk, walk and eventually eat and breathe for herself. Her family first noticed something was wrong in , when she suddenly began acting out of character. However she was not diagnosed until  and sadly passed away in . Jordan said: “Mum was full of love and very much a people person. “No one had a bad word to say about her, she was very kind and lovely. “We’d noticed irregularities in her behaviour. I remember one Saturday she went to pick up Kennedy from school but it was a weekend. “Her character changed from being a loving woman and she became quite cold. “She seemed to lack compassion which was a huge change from when she’d covered us in love. “She slowly got stripped of her communication. She couldn’t talk a lot and then she began to lose her mobility and couldn’t go out alone. “As the disease progressed she lost the ability to walk and care for herself and for the last  months she was bedridden. It was heartwrenching.”  Jordan said that despite his initial shock, he and girlfriend Lucy have discussed plans for their future together and that he feels like his diagnosis will give him a unique perspective on le. They are considering having IVF when they decide to start a family as the process will allow doctors to screen his sperm for the dementia-carrying gene. Jordan said: “I feel like the diagnosis is actually a licence to live. “It’ll make me step back and appreciate the bigger picture. It’s going to allow me to make choices to live a fulfilled le. Lucy added: “We’ve decided that it’d be probably best to have children first and then get married. “We know it’s dferent to how most people would it do but it’ll give Jordan more time with his kids. “It’s hard to deal with knowing he won’t be there one day but it’s important to retain perspective. “We will have a le together despite everything.”

title: penguin shortage means telford exotic
story: NewsPenguin shortage means Telford Exotic Zoo uses models instead of real animalsPenguin malaria has meant a delivery of six Humboldt penguins has not arrivedShareCommentsByEd Chatterton:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsModels are being used instead of real animals "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA zoo has been forced to fill a brand new enclosure with model penguins - because the cannot get hold of the real thing. A shortage of birds has meant visitors to Exotic Zoo, in Telford, Shropshire, have been left disappointed. Their latest exhibit has been filled with plastic figurines of the flightless birds. Tens of thousands of pounds has been spent on the new specialist enclosure which was due to open in time for the summer holidays. A delivery of six Humboldt penguins, which are native to South America, was expected this July but the zoo was unable to get any due to an outbreak of avian malaria.  Zoo director Scott Adams instead decided to fill the empty enclosure with models until they can get real penguins for visitors to enjoy. TV animal man Scott, , - who was a regular face on Blue Peter and The Alan Titchmarsh Show - said: Weve just timed it really badly. The enclosure is the zoos most expensive to date and we had hoped to have it open for the start of the summer holidays. But then disaster struck. Because of the outbreak of penguin malaria we were unable to get hold of three pairs we had been planning to get in for visitors to enjoy. Instead weve had to use le-size models of ious dferent species of penguins so we can at least educate visitors to an extent.  Weve got signs up explaining the situation. Its been really disappointing but its been out of our control really. Unfortunately over the last couple of years there was a really bad case of penguin malaria that swept through the UK. Lots of zoos,not most zoos, have lost a lot of penguins and in some case most of their stock. Most of the big zoos are getting their penguins back so any spares that would have come to us from the surplus lists or from stud books from other zoos are not available. Because we are a relatively small zoo we are not top of the list when it comes to replenishing those numbers. Penguins only mate once a year, so weve got to sit back and let nature take its course until the numbers build up in the UK and Europe. Scott is even planning to dress a member of his staff in a penguin costume over the Christmas period as he doesnt believe the problem will be rectied until the new year. He added: Were not really anticipating getting any real penguins in until next year, which is a real shame considering the enclosure cost us tens of thousands of pounds. Weve already got contingency plans in place for the Christmas period when we will dress up a member of staff in a penguin costume so at least the children will have something to enjoy. We had a private company come in and created for us a really impressive enclosure, complete with clfs, rockwork and water features. It took a couple of months.

title: russian instagram model boiling water
story: NewsRussian Instagram model has boiling water thrown over her chest by fellow inmate jealous of her glamorous looksKira Mayer is shocked by le behind bars, craving oysters and wanting to have hotel service from her cellShareCommentsByWill Stewart:,  OCT NewsInstagram celebrity Kira Mayer,  "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A Russian Instagram “princess” who was jailed after reportedly offering traffic police a threesome to turn a blind eye to her motoring offence claims a fellow inmate poured boiling water over her chest. Model Kira Mayer, , claimed she was victimised behind bars with many prisoners resenting her glamorous looks.Her chest was scalded “to the bone” in the alleged attack and months after the incident she still has a “red bleeding scar,” she said. She claims she got into a row with her cellmates who expected her as a “newcomer” to clean the cell and toilet. And the social-media star is shocked by le in prison in general - and says she wants to be fed oysters and have hotel service.  Speaking of the alleged attack, Mayer said: “Its been two months now, there was a deep burn to the bone. “And here they did not even give me any special medication to treat this. “I was just sent to the punishment box. “Im not a rebel, but I was strongly against the pressure on ‘newcomers . Despite reports that she suffered facial injuries the model revealed to a human rights monitor that the serious wound was to her chest. Human rights monitor and prison visitor Eva Merkacheva - also a prominent Russian journalist - wrote: “Incredibly, she manages to look the same behind bars as she looks in her Instagram. “Long hair, and huge doll-like eyelashes.”  The prisoner, used to tropical photoshoots and exotic holidays, said: “I’m always beautulthe media visit me.” And Mayer has not let the incident prevent her from making a series of extraordinary demands from warders in her Moscow detention centre ahead of her move to a penal colony for her  month sentence. But insistence on being served oysters and deliveries from top restaurants has not gone down well. Mayer said: When they brought me some strange porridge for breakfast, I asked: Can I have a hot croissant, orange fresh, mixed omelette and cheese  “I thought it was possible to order food here like in hotel. They laughed. “Next, they have such ugly metal bowls here. I cant eat from them, I’m afraid.” She said she only eats on plastic plates delivered by her family. “I am offering to introduce a paid service for delivery from restaurants so that they can bring oysters and fish, she said. “I want oysters so badly.”  She complained: “My bed is made of metal bars. “I asked for a normal one with an orthopaedic mattress, and they laughed at me again. It also turned out phones are not allowed here. I used to have three mobile phones and was on Instagram all the time. “I askedI could get even the most basic iPhone with internet but they laughed at me even more.” Mayer pleaded guilty to assaulting a traffic police officer who stopped her driving her Mercedes without a licence on the way to a manicure in Moscow. She offered a threesome to the officer and his colleaguethey ignored her motoring offence, according to reports citing law enforcement sources. Later she said she “told myself I had to continue living. “Now I almost dont cry,” said Mayer, ex-girlfriend of Russian pop-singer Alexey Vorobyov. “My regular le is gone. “I was on the way to my manicure - but ended up in a detention jail.” She said: “Only now do I realise I used to live like a princess. “I spent the whole summer behind bars, its sad. “I want to go to the Seychelles. “I do breathing exercises and it makes it better. “Half of my fellow inmates didnt like me straight away for my looks. “The other half were asking me all sorts of girly questions.”  She also blamed her female judge Katerina Kirichenko for her “harsh” sentence, claiming she “did not like me”. “In our country you can go to jail simply because you annoy someone,” she said. She admitted trying to hide the fact that she had been jailed “but it leaked out”. She said: “I realised that jail might be good and will increase my popularity.” Her latest ploy is to suggest a hair selling business to her jail governor.

title: mums shock shes told shes
story: NewsMums shock as shes told shes let herself go after having kids - but then she realises something brilliantAn encounter with an old friend left mum-of-three Amy Weatherly wonderingshed let herself goShareCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsAmys friend was shocked by how dferent she looked after having kids "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIn high school, Amy Weatherly was the girl who only wore wedges and trendy tops. She never went anywhere without make-up, big hair and jewelery and was voted the girliest girl and most likely to wear heels in her year.The writer and mother-of-three didnt think too much about her had changed, until she recently ran into an old friend from school who made a few comments that hit a little too close to home. But instead of wallowing in her feelings and getting down, Amy hit back in an inspirational Facebook post. The -year-old from Texas wrote: I saw a friend I hadn’t seen in a while today. We chatted and hugged and she laughed and said I can’t believe I’m seeing you out in public with no makeup and tennis shoes. Who even are you anymore  I laughed because it’s true. In a past le, in a galaxy far far away, I was the girl never without jewelry, and lip gloss, and loads of foundation. I had myself together. I was voted “girliest girl” and “most likely to wear heels” for crying out loud. And now... Well, now is a completely dferent story.Amy then joked to her friend that having that third baby really forced [her] to let [herself] go.She continued: We chatted for another minute, about this and that and nothing important. We hugged, promised to grab lunch soon, knew we probably never would, and went our separate ways.  But I kept thinking about my words, they kept rolling through my head over and over that day and left me feeling like crap: let myself go. I knew I didnt look the same as I did before, but had I actually let myself go  Ten extra lbs and a messy bun would point to yes, but my heart screamed HECK TO THE NO YOU HAVE NOT, GIRLFRIEND. Im more confident now. Im more sure of myself. Im less likely to cry over a breakout, or miss out on a night with my girls because of dirty hair. Truth is, I kind of like myself now, definitely more than I did before. I wouldn’t go back to that girl with the good hair for all the skinny jeans and skinny lattes in the world.  Amy then asked why it is we continue to use the phrase let herself go and saidpeople just took a step back and thought about it all for a moment, theyd realise they hadnt let themselves go at all. There’s a good chance we’ll discover they have in fact found themselves and appreciated themselves and loved themselves and realized that who they are as a human has absolutely nothing to do with their fake eyelashes or their highlights or their giant leathery feathery earrings , and absolutely everything to do with their heart, and their mind, and their soul, she proclaimed. She ended her post by reminding other parents that they are so much more than just a pretty face. You haven’t let yourself go. Stop saying that. It’s rude. It’s derogatory, and it’s downright absurd. You haven’t let yourself go, you have simply let go of the need to look perfect all of the time, she said. Put on makeup when you can, get your hair did when you find the time, pamper yourself, take care of yourself, splurge on a new outfit and don’t you dare feel bad about it for one second — just know that none of those outside things define you. Not anymore. They aren’t you. They are things, and there is a huge dference between the two. You are more than just a pretty face.  You are a momma. You are a we. You are a sister. You are a lover. You are a fighter. You are a warrior. You are a daughter. You are a student. You are a teacher. You are a dreamer. You are a doer. You are a giver. You are a believer. You are you, and that can never be taken away from you. The emotional post has been liked over , times and shared more than  times. Many women said that they were grateful to have read it.

title: indonesia earthquake final words air
story: NewsIndonesia earthquake: Final words of air traffic controller who sacriced own le to save plane carrying hundredsAnthonius Gunawan Agung was the only worker left in the air traffic control tower after his colleagues fled in terror and stayed behind to make sure a plane carrying hundreds of passengers could take off safelyShareCommentsByYishu NgYimin WooElaine McCahill:,  OCT NewsAnthonius Gunawan Agung stayed behind in the crumbling traffic control tower to make sure a plane carrying hundreds could take off safely as the earthquake hit "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAn Indonesian pilot hailed an air traffic controller who died in Fridays earthquake as aangel for ensuring a passenger plane took off safely before he jumped in vain for safety. Anthonius Gunawan Agung, , was among at least , people who died in the devastating .-magnitude quake and tsunami that hit Sulawesi island.When disaster struck, Agung stayed behind in the crumbling four-storey control tower at Palu airport to make sure a plane carrying hundreds of passengers could take off.Agung, , refused to leave the tower despite the danger and he was the only worker left as he guided Batik Air flight  to safety.  Agungs last words, according to pilot Ricoseta Mafella, were: Batik , runway , clear for takeoff. He was saying it in a very calm manner, because the earthquake hadnt started yet, Mafella told Reuters. Then the earthquake struck. I felt that the aircraft was moving slightly to the right and to the left, Mafella said. Agung waited for the plane, bound from Palu to Makassar, to become airborne before leaving the control tower, authorities said. He stayed... until the last of my departure, until the tower was shaking very bad, Mafella added.  Once he made sure that the aircraft had departed safely, he jumped from his tower to the lower level. He suffered internal injuries and a broken leg, and was rushed to hospital by his colleagues. A helicopter was ordered to take him to a dferent hospital for specialist care, and he was transported back to Mutiara SIS Al-Jufrie Airport on Saturday morning to be picked up. However, he died before the helicopter arrived.  Air Nav Indonesia spokesman Yohannes Sirait said Mr Agungs decision to stay behind cost him his le, but he may have saved hundreds of others. The airline also said in a statement that it would posthumously raise Agungs rank by two levels as a sign of appreciation. The company tweeted out images showing Agungs body being carried to a helicopter during his funeral procession in Makassar.
